intro: Alsomitra cissoides, commonly known as the creeping alsomitra, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, which are typical of its family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated as a houseplant or in shaded garden settings.
